snippet: A deeper look at the rebels in Ukraine offers a murky picture of their aims, motivations and connections. They appear to be Ukrainians, but they have deep ties to and affinity for Russia.
abstract: Persistent mystery in conflict in Ukraine has been identity and affiliations of militiamen, who have pressed confrontation between Russia and the West into its latest bitter phase; deeper look at the 12th Company, one such militia, reveals that its members appear to be Ukrainians with deep ties to and affinity for Russia, all of whom possess tangled mix of identities and loyalties.

byline.original: By C. J. CHIVERS and NOAH SNEIDER

lead_paragraph: A deeper look at the rebels in Ukraine offers a murky picture of their aims, motivations and connections. They appear to be Ukrainians, but they have deep ties to and affinity for Russia.

headline.main: Behind the Masks in Ukraine, Many Faces of Rebellion
headline.print_headline: Behind the Masks in Ukraine, Many Faces of Rebellion
